attributes.additional_details:
A 16/17 year old is able to pay tax; so why are they declined the right to vote?
Reducing the voting age to 16/17 will introduce a further 1,500,000 voters to the electorate and will create a larger influence on political issues. 
Many 16/17 year olds are already politically active in environmental and European issues and care deeply for the country and the future of our world; yet with their position in society, they have less opportunity to express their views and put forward opinion.
attributes.background: By signing this petition, it would allow government to discuss this issue. The lowering of voting age would enable 16/17 year olds to vote in a possible upcoming referendum or general election for the future of Britain. It would further our journey to universal suffrage and increase equality.
